38.author: [No author]

An adaptation of the book by Alexandre Dumas.

Summary: "Set in seventeenth-century England and France, this classic rip-roaring tale tells of valour, intrigue, and love. The three musketeers, Athos, Porthos, and Aramis, and their companion, D'Artagnan, fight and love their way through a series of hair-raising adventures."

116.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
116.title: "Bring Back That Spark Plug"
116.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon has disturbed Garfield's sleep with his lawnmowing.

117.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
117.title: Garfield Goes to Disobedience School
117.author: created by Jim Davis ; written by Scott Nickel ; designed and illustrated by Mike Fentz.
notes: Troll, 1997.
Summary: Jon has sent Garfield to Pet Obedience School, where all the other students are dogs.
Genre: Funny animal fiction.

118.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
118.title: "I Think I'll Skip Desert"
118.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon remarks to Irma at the diner that the food tastes odd; she's given him Fido's lunch by mistake.

119.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
119.title: "I'd Straighten that Left Arm a Bit, and Turn that Right Hand Over More"
119.author: Jim Davis
119.appears_in: reproduced on p. 137 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Jon has knocked out an old lady with his golf shot, and asks Garfield for advice.

120.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
120.title: "If You Add Water, It Makes Its Own Gravy"
120.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon is apparently eating cat food.

121.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
121.title: "Is Nothing Sacred?"
121.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Garfield uses Jon's toothbrush, dental floss, and mouthwash.
Key word: Bathrooms.

122.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
122.title: "I've Never Been so Ashamed in My Life"
122.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: When he sees how Jon is dressed, Garfield thinks they may be going to clown college. When he finds out they're going to play golf, Garfield appears with a bag over his head.

123.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
123.title: "Leave Odie's Food Alone!"
123.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Garfield and Jon are on diets, and both are eyeing Odie's dinner.

124.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
124.title: "Next Time Warn Me Before You Get Ready to Play Golf"
124.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon startles Garfield by appearing suddenly in his golf clothes.

125.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
125.title: "Right After Our Sissy Hangin'"
125.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon's all duded up in a new cowboy suit, and wants to hit the trail.

126.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
126.title: "Silly, Yet Effective"
126.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Garfield's on a grapefruit diet; he tries to eat a pie and Jon hits him with a grapefruit.

127.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
127.title: "Then I Started Thinking- Lawn Ornaments"
127.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon had been wondering what to do if Garfield passed on.

128.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
128.title: "There Had Better Be Food on the Front Lawn"
128.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon says the world's exciting.

129.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
129.title: "Tomorrow We'll Do Something You Like"
129.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Garfield is unraveling Jon's dental floss.
Key words: Bathrooms, sinks, amusements.

130.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
130.title: "You Seen My Lucky Rock?"
130.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon settles down to a nice peaceful meal, and something crunches in his food.

131.heading: Arbuckle, Jon.
131.title: "Your Eyebrows Needed Thinning"
131.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: As Jon sleeps, Garfield uses the tweezers on him.

132.heading: Arbuckle, Jon--Miscellanea.
